A freelance highway engineer's adventures in time & space. The street is not too narrow, your imagination is too narrow.

I'm interested in making urban places safe and easy for walking, wheeling and cycling.

I'm currently trying to make a living running my micro-consultancy, City Infinity, and I also write for Highways Magazine.

I also dabble a bit in home-brewing and fruit growing/ foraging, plus I am a bit of a Lego addict and a fan of silly action films.

I'm based in London, UK.

note:
I'm a #hacker. Question my use of that term? Well I have been in the truest sense of that term since I was a young kid. I'm also a #CISO, 25+ years in tech have been good to me overall. I serve on multiple boards as well, back to that whole "tech has treated me well thing". I'm fortunate to be an Internationally recognized Public #Speaker and the Author of "Cyber Security Career Guide". I do my level best to give back to this community.

I'm also a #pilot and love #aviation. I live in the northern Midwest of the US so if I want good #BBQ I gotta make it myself, and that's just what I do.

If you're reading an opinion I posted I assure you it's mine and does not reflect the views of my employer or any organizations I'm affiliated with.

My pronouns are she/her, and if my listing that bothers you, GTFOH right now.

Come for the #infosec, stay for #HackerFlightSchool, and eat all the #HackerBBQ

Definitely Not a Parody Account, although I did stay at a Holiday Inn Express last night.

note:
Omnigamer (theres a time/place). I see #tabletop #boardgames as an in-person/social function. Enjoys #systemdesign (both #boardgamedesign & in general). I'm a "beer & pretzels" #gamer *most* of the time, but I appreciate many historical or #wargames.

Besides gaming, I'm an IT professional with a career involving non-profits in various specialty sectors (e.g. medical, education, etc). While I rarely talk about my work here, I do follow (and boost) accounts outside of gaming as a result. I'm generally inquisitive, I adore discussions of ideas/concepts, I'm skeptical, & I value honesty (I certainly don't sugar coat...). I'm particularly fond of history, science, and research related posts/people. I'm not here for the generic outrage, that's one thing I don't miss from Twitter (I filter out a bunch of hashtags on my Home timeline as a result).

While I barely have a grasp on English, I do have a DeepL translation key and I'm adventurous with it. I'm happy to follow/interact with folks who post in other languages if I know they are likely to understand my English responses (as translating outbound is more complicated).

Initial posts: 70% tabletop games, 30% misc. If I say something and you don't understand the reference, feel free to ask!
Replies: Are >80% of my activity and (along w/ boosts) topically run wild.
Favorites: "thank you for posting, and I have no response"
Boosts: "I found this interesting/amusing (and *probably* agree with it at least a little bit)"

Previously at @gpage@tabletop.social (Nov '22 -> Sept '23)

#fedi22

note:
I'm a rebel, baby. I'm revolting.

-------------------------------

I'm #British and #Nigerian. I work in IT, but would much rather be hanging out with my kids.

I listen to far too many #podcasts so I know a little about a lot, and a lot about very little.

Just another nerdy human bean. Thinking too much about everything, posting about some things.

Don't expect any consistent major topic. If I knew it myself, I'd tell you. But mostly you'll find here: #programming, #computerscience, #math, #academia, #ADHD and #random thoughts. Sometimes also bad attempts at creativity or entertainment.

note: Fifteen years at the other place. Post Punk tech Luddite. First toot June 2 2023.

I'm a Mountain Leader (IML and WML) and wildlife guide. I work mainly in Scotland and the Lake District, as well as overseas. I live on Isle of Arran

I'm also an otter groupie, seabird fan, cyclist, would-be runner and sporadic climber. Sometimes I'm even to be found in a kayak. I live with my husband Wally and two furballs called Nuis 🐕 and Mango 🐱.

I toot about my life, my work, and love to boost stuff about nature, especially the geekier stuff.

She/Her

note:
I’m an Australian fan of books, monsters, and books about monsters. Sometimes I even write them myself, and am the author of Liesmith, Stormbringer, The Dragon of Rosemont High, and the editor of the monstrous Unnatural Order anthology.

When I’m not doing that, I also occasionally code, blog, review books by other people, and make bad art.

As a terminally online fan of the old web, I can also be found on Dreamwidth, followed via RSS, or federated via @alis@alis.me. I'm elsewhere on fedi as @alis@fandom.ink, @alis@orphaned.monster and @askalis@bookwyrm.social.

In my spare time, I’m probably playing far too much Final Fantasy XIV. If you’re feeling up for a chat, I’m also on Discord.
